topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Add New Scale-out Object Node

body.p: Perform the following procedure to add new scale-out object node.

li.xref: Adding node and disks to object-ring:1

ul.li:
HPE Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.
(Starter Swift nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)
Perform the steps mentioned in Provision Swift Node(s) to deploy a new node.

section.title: Adding nodes and disks to object-ring:1
section.p: Once the Swift nodes are deployed, the required disks must be formatted and mounted them before adding them to the Swift cluster.

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud from the seed.# ssh heat-admin@<undercloud IP address> # sudo -i
Change the working directory to the ring building directory.# cd /root/ring-building
List the available scale-out Swift nodes and identify the newly-created node(s).# ringos list-swift-nodes -t object
List the disks available on the node.# ringos list-disks -n <object nodes IP address>

Format the given disk.# ringos format-disks -n <object nodes IP address> -d <disk>
You can format all the disks with a single command: -d --all.
List the files in the ring building directory and identify the object-1.builder file.

Add the formatted disk(s) to the object-1 ring.# ringos add-disk-to-ring -f /root/ring-building/object-1.builder -i <Object nodes IP address> -p <port> -d <disk label> -w <weight> -r <region> -z <zone>
Recommendation: Add drives gradually using a weighted approach to avoid degraded performance of the Swift cluster. The weight will gradually increase by 25% until it reaches 100%. The initial weight is 25.

Re-balance the object-1 ring.# ringos rebalance-ring -f /root/ring-building/object-1.builder
You must wait for the length of time specified in min_part_hours before another re-balance succeeds.
List all the Swift nodes.# ringos list-swift-nodes -t all
Copy object-1.ring.gz file to all the nodes.# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/object-1.ring.gz -n <Swift nodes IP address>
Set the weight of the disks using the following command:# ringos set-weight -f /root/ring-building/object-1.builder -s <object node IP address> -w <weight>
Repeat steps from 8-11 as necessary, increasing the weight by 25 each time. [Change the weight to 50, then 75, and then 100 (w= 50, 75, 100).]
